com.ikalagaming.packages

Class PackageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.packages.PackageManager

  • public class PackageManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles loading, unloading and storage of Packages. This is considered a package, but is always enabled and never loaded.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PackageManager(EventManager evtManager)
      Constructs a new PackageManager and initializes variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PackageManager

        public PackageManager(EventManager evtManager)
        Constructs a new PackageManager and initializes variables.
        Parameters:
        evtManager - The event manager to use for the package system

    • Method Detail

      • destoryInstance

        public static void destoryInstance()
        Shuts down the static instance (unregisters commands and unloads packages)if it exists, and then nullifies the reference to it. This exists in case you wish to use your own instances of the Package Manager and not use the single static instance provided. If the instance does not exist, nothing happens. Note that a new static instance may be created if the instance is requested later.
        See Also:
        getInstance(), getInstance(EventManager)

      • getInstance

        public static PackageManager getInstance()
        Returns the static instance of the package manager. Since there should only be one of these, having a static instance is fine and any class can get the instance which all other classes should share. If there is no instance yet, one will be created.
        Returns:
        the static instance of the Package Manager
        See Also:
        getInstance(EventManager), destoryInstance()

      • getInstance

        public static PackageManager getInstance(EventManager manager)
        Returns the static instance of the package manager. Since there should only be one of these, having a static instance is fine and any class can get the instance which all other classes should share. If there is no instance yet, one will be created.
        Parameters:
        manager - the event manager to use for the static instance
        Returns:
        the static instance of the Package Manager
        See Also:
        getInstance(), destoryInstance()

      • clearCommands

        public void clearCommands()
        Unregisters all commands

      • containsCommand

        public boolean containsCommand(java.lang.String s)
        Returns true if the array contains the given string.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to look for
        Returns:
        true if the string exists

      • disable

        public boolean disable(Package target)
        Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations. The package is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls Package.onDisable(). This changes the packages state to DISABLING. The package state is changed to DISABLED after completion. If Package.onDisable() returns false (failed), the package state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - the package to disable
        Returns:
        true if the package has been successfully disabled, false if there was a problem

      • disable

        public boolean disable(java.lang.String target)
        Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations. The package is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls Package.onDisable(). This changes the packages state to DISABLING. The package state is changed to DISABLED after completion. If Package.onDisable() returns false (failed), the package state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - the name of the package to disable
        Returns:
        true if the package has been successfully disabled, false if there was a problem

      • enable

        public boolean enable(Package target)
        Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls Package.onEnable(). This changes the package state to ENABLING. The package state is changed to ENABLED after completion. If Package.onEnable() returns false (failed), the package state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - The package to enable
        Returns:
        true if the package was successfully enabled, false if there was a problem

      • enable

        public boolean enable(java.lang.String target)
        Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls Package.onEnable(). This changes the package state to ENABLING. The package state is changed to ENABLED after completion. If Package.onEnable() returns false (failed), the package state is set to CORRUPTED.
        Parameters:
        target - The name of the package to enable
        Returns:
        true if the package was successfully enabled, false if there was a problem

      • enableOnLoad

        public boolean enableOnLoad()
        Returns true if this package manager automatically enables packages when they are loaded. If they are not enabled on load, they must be enabled manually after being loaded.
        Returns:
        true if the packages enable after loading, false if they must be manually enabled
        See Also:
        setEnableOnLoad(boolean)

      • fireEvent

        public boolean fireEvent(Event event)
        Fires an event with a message to a package type from the package manager. If an error occurs, this will return false. The event should not have been sent if false was returned.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to fire
        Returns:
        true if the event was fired correctly

      • getCommandParent

        public Package getCommandParent(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the package that registered the given string, or null if it cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to look for
        Returns:
        the owner of the command

      • getCommands

        public java.util.ArrayList<PackageCommand> getCommands()
        Returns a clone of the commands list.
        Returns:
        a copy of the stored list

      • getLoadedPackages

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Package> getLoadedPackages()
        Returns the map of package name to package of the currently loaded packages.
        Returns:
        the package map

      • getPackage

        public Package getPackage(java.lang.String type)
        If a package of type exists (isLoaded(String)), then the package that is of that type is returned. If no package exists of that type, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        type - The package type
        Returns:
        the Package with the given type or null if none exists

      • getPackageState

        public PackageState getPackageState(Package target)
        Returns the current state of the package.
        Parameters:
        target - The package to fetch the state of
        Returns:
        a PackageState representing the status of this package

      • getResourceBundle

        public java.util.ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
        Returns the resource bundle for the package manager. This is not safe and could be null.
        Returns:
        the current resource bundle

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(Package target)
        Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise. A state of ENABLED returns true, any other states will return false. Packages that are not loaded will return false.
        Parameters:
        target - The package to check for enabled status
        Returns:
        true if the package is fully ready to operate

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(java.lang.String target)
        Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise. A state of ENABLED returns true, any other states will return false. Packages that are not loaded will return false.
        Parameters:
        target - The name of package to check for enabled status
        Returns:
        true if the package is fully ready to operate

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(Package type)
        Returns true if a package exists that has the same type as the provided package (for example: "Graphics"). This is the same as calling isLoaded(Package.getName())
        Parameters:
        type - the package type
        Returns:
        true if the package is loaded in memory, false if it does not exist

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(java.lang.String type)
        Returns true if a package exists with the given type (for example: "Graphics")'
        Parameters:
        type - the package type
        Returns:
        true if the package is loaded in memory, false if it does not exist

      • loadPackage

        public boolean loadPackage(Package toLoad)

        Loads the given package into memory, stores it by type, and enables it if packages are enabled on load by default.

        If the type of package already exists in the manager, and the new package has a higher version number, then the old package is unloaded and the new one is loaded in its place. If the versions are equal, or the new package is older, then it does not load the new version and returns false.

        Parameters:
        toLoad - the package to load
        Returns:
        true if the package was loaded properly, false otherwise
        See Also:
        enableOnLoad()

      • loadPlugin

        public boolean loadPlugin(PackageInfo info)

      • loadPlugin

        public boolean loadPlugin(java.lang.String path,
                          java.lang.String name)
        Loads a plugin from a name
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the folder containing the file
        name - the filename to load from
        Returns:
        true on success, false if it failed

      • registerCommand

        public boolean registerCommand(java.lang.String command,
                               Package owner)
        Attempts to register the command for the given class. If the command already exists, an error is logged and the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to register
        owner - what package is registering the command
        Returns:
        true if the command registered successfully

      • reload

        public boolean reload(Package target)
        This is essentially restarting the package. The package is disabled if it is enabled, unloaded, then loaded.
        Parameters:
        target - The package to reload
        Returns:
        true if the package reloaded successfully, false otherwise

      • setEnableOnLoad

        public void setEnableOnLoad(boolean newValue)
        Sets the flag for automatically enabling packages when they are loaded. If they are not enabled on load, they must be enabled manually after being loaded.

        This allows some customization of how the package system works.

        Parameters:
        newValue - true if the packages should be automatically enabled after loading, false if they should be manually enabled

      • unloadPackage

        public void unloadPackage(Package toUnload)
        Attempts to unload the package from memory. Does nothing if the package is not loaded. Packages are disabled before unloading. This calls unloadPackage(String) using the package type.
        Parameters:
        toUnload - The type of package to unload

      • unloadPackage

        public boolean unloadPackage(java.lang.String toUnload)
        Attempts to unload the package from memory. If no package exists with the given name (isLoaded(String)), returns false and does nothing.
        Parameters:
        toUnload - The type of package to unload
        Returns:
        true if the package was unloaded properly

      • unregisterCommand

        public boolean unregisterCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Unregisters the given command.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to remove
        Returns:
        true if the command was removed

      • unregisterPackageCommands

        public void unregisterPackageCommands(Package owner)
        Removes all commands that the given package registered.
        Parameters:
        owner - the package which is having commands removed
